alert.note: Alert for Lexington (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lexington and northwestern Richland Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Columbia International University, or over St. Andrews, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Springdale, St. Andrews, Dentsville, Oak Grove, Arcadia Lakes, Villages at Sandhill, Columbia International University, Killian, Harbison State Forest, Riverbanks Zoo, Woodfield, Sesquicentennial State Park, Lake Carolina, West Columbia Riverwalk and Fort Jackson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 61 and 78. Interstate 26 between mile markers 99 and 112. Interstate 77 between mile markers 11 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
